sen.j: 黄泉醜女（よもつしこめ）は、日本神話に伝わる黄泉の鬼女。
sen.e: Yomotsu-shikome is Kijo (an ogress) of Yomi (world after death) which has been handed down by Japanese Mythology.
Yomotsu-shikome is a female demon of the afterworld in Japanese Mythology.

sen.j: イザナミが自分との約束を破って逃げ出したイザナギを捕まえるため、黄泉醜女にイザナギを追わせた。
sen.e: Izanami (The Female Who Invites) made Yomotsu-shikome chase Izanagi (The Male Who Invites) in desire to catch him because he had ran away from her breaking his promise.

sen.j: イザナギは蔓草で出来た髪飾りを投げつけた所、そこから山ブドウの実が生えた。
sen.e: When Izanagi threw a hair ornamentation made of tsurukusa (vine), it bore bunches of wild grape.

sen.j: 黄泉醜女はそれに食いつくも、食べ終わると再びイザナギを追いかけた。
sen.e: Yomotsu-shikome once stopped chasing him as she sank her teeth into them but she started chasing again after she finished eating.

sen.j: 次にイザナギは右の角髪から湯津津間櫛（ゆつつなくし）を取り、その歯を折って投げた。
sen.e: Then, Izanagi took his yutsutsunakushi (comb) from his right tsunogami (a style of hairdo in ancient Japan, in which the hair was twisted into knots on top of the head and held in place with pins), snapped off a tooth of the comb and threw it at her.
